snippets¶

The daq module provides functions that might be useful for performing measurements and analyzing data. Some functions in the module are completely unrelated to data acquisition, and are purely analysis. It is essentially a module of code that would otherwise be repeated lots of times in experiment runs.

setup_control.snippets.clean_data(arr, remove=False, rpl='nan')¶

Cleans a data array, removing blank or non-number entries. Any changes are documented by printing to the console. Returns a numpy array populated with floats.

Parameters:
  • arr – The array to clean.
  • remove – If true, rows with empty strings will simply be removed.
  • rpl – The string to replace empty strings with.
Returns:

A cleaned numpy array populated with floats.
setup_control.snippets.print_attributes(sweep)¶

Prints the attributes associated with the sweep to the console. This should be included in notes about each sweep.

Parameters:sweep – The sweep to extract attributes from.
setup_control.snippets.sweep_parameter(parameter_set_func, values_to_sweep, time_constant=100, sensitivity=0.2, slope=12, load_time=4, lock_in_time=0, chopper_amplitude=5, chopper_frequency=1, power=15, freq_synth_frequency=250, multiplier=18, save_path='')¶

This method sweeps a parameter through a set of values. Any parameter can be chosen. If the chosen parameter is represented in one of this functions arguments, whatever is entered for that argument will be ignored,

Parameters:
  • parameter_set_func – The function that sets the parameter the user wishes to sweep through, i.e. wrapper.set_continuous_wave_freq.
  • values_to_sweep – The values to sweep the parameter through, i.e. range(200, 301, 2),
  • time_constant – The lock-in amplifier time constant in ms.
  • sensitivity – The lock-in amplifier sensitivity in mV.
  • slope – The lock-in amplifier roll off slope in dB/octave.
  • load_time – The amount of time to give the instruments to finish setting up before data collection begins.
  • lock_in_time – The amount of time to give the lock in amplifier to lock back onto the reference signal after a parameter is changed.
  • chopper_amplitude – The amplitude of the chopper signal in V.
  • chopper_frequency – The frequency of the chopper signal in kHz.
  • power – The power of the sweeper in dBm.
  • freq_synth_frequency – The frequency of the sweeper in GHz.
  • multiplier – The multiplier (i.e. product of all frequency multipliers in the setup).
  • save_path – If a non-empty string variable save_path is passed the the sweep will be saved as a .npy file with the sweep settings saved in metadata.
Returns:

The data collected, where the first column is frequency, the second column is X, and the third column is Y. X and Y are in volts.
